The recent Premiere Napa Valley 2016, which culminated with an auction of 226 wine barrel futures at the Culinary Institute of America at Greystone, was the perfect opportunity to talk to a lot of winemakers.

item.title: Drink In the Downton Abbey Finale | Wine Enthusiast Magazine
item.description:
Drink In the Downton Abbey Finale | Wine Enthusiast Magazine

The curtains will close on PBS's beloved British soap opera Downton Abbey on March 6, and if you're longtime fans like us, you'll need a drink in order to cope. Throughout the lavishly costumed series, which chronicles 14 years of upper-crust intrigue on an aristocratic English estate, drinks have played a central role-so much that a Downton Abbey-inspired wine collection was released in 2013 and expanded last year.

item.title: California: A region on a role
item.description:
California: A region on a role

FEW ASSOCIATIONS in the wine world are as strong as California and Cabernet. With a history stretching back to the 1870s, the state has been playing with this high-profile grape for well over a century, although it wasn't until the 1970s that Californian Cabernet really gained global acclaim.

item.title: Yao Ming in St Helena: Basketball star turned vintner opens a new tasting room
item.description:
Yao Ming in St Helena: Basketball star turned vintner opens a new tasting room

It was during his years playing basketball as a 7-foot-6 center for the Houston Rockets of the NBA that Yao Ming, who is from Shanghai, China, became interested in wine. He can thank his teammate, Dikembe Mutombo, for the introduction to red wine.

item.title: Explore Napa's Hidden Lovall Valley
item.description:
Explore Napa's Hidden Lovall Valley

Want to spend a few hours cycling in an idyllic setting? Take a spin through Napa's Lovall Valley, where you'll find rolling vineyards, architecturally interesting homes, and roadside art set in a compact bowl of verdant green hills.

item.title: Ask a Somm: When Should I Decant Wine?
item.description:
Ask a Somm: When Should I Decant Wine?

Back before the days of Roy Choi and Michael Voltaggio, Los Angeles was home to chefs like Wolfgang Puck, Nancy Silverton, and Josiah Citrin - the city's old guard. Perhaps retaining some of L.A.'s original DNA, those latter chefs have mostly stayed true to proper white tablecloth dining, a nearly extinct species among the city's influx of fermentation and bowls of raw fish.

item.title: 2016 Bud Break - Earliest Ever? Napa Valley growing season begins
item.description:
2016 Bud Break - Earliest Ever? Napa Valley growing season begins

With the combination of warm temperatures and relatively little recent rain, bud break has begun in Napa Valley, marking the beginning of the winegrape growing season. "Buds on chardonnay have begun swelling and bursting on a few vines.

item.title: Yountville: K. Laz offers rarefied tastings
item.description:
Yountville: K. Laz offers rarefied tastings

"Inaccessible" doesn't seem to have a place in K. Laz Wine Collection owner Kerrin Laz's vocabulary. With the debut of her posh tasting room in downtown Yountville this past fall, she's seeking to share the wealth, offering by-appointment, private sit-down samplings of treasures like the nearly impossible-to-find 2012 Screaming Eagle Second Flight ($635), and the forthcoming Screaming Eagle Cabernet Sauvignon 2013 (price TBD), expected to be released in March.

item.description:
